meanings.definition: A claim or assertion of a claim to something.
meanings.sent1: Her pretensions to the throne were quickly dismissed by the council.
meanings.sent2: His pretensions to the title of best player on the team were unfounded.
meanings.sent3: Despite his pretensions to being a great chef, his burnt toast was a constant reminder of his lack of skill.
meanings.sent4: The company's pretensions to market dominance were shattered by the unexpected competition.
meanings.sent5: The cat's pretensions to ruling the house were evident in the way it demanded attention from everyone.

meanings.definition: The quality of having or showing the unpleasant quality of people who think of themselves as more impressive, successful, or important than they really are.
meanings.sent1: Her pretensions of grandeur made her unpopular among her peers.
meanings.sent2: His pretensions were evident in the way he constantly bragged about his nonexistent accomplishments.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's pretensions to being the funniest person in the room were shattered when no one laughed at his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The politician's pretensions to honesty were quickly exposed by the media.
meanings.sent5: The actor's pretensions to fame were dashed when his movie flopped at the box office.
